channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The realm of nite lattices in combination with a new dimension
item.description: arXiv:2503.22007v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The Ordered Set Theory is a branch of Mathematics that studies partially ordered sets (usually posets) and lattices. The meaning of dimension is one of the main parts of this eld. Dimensions of partially ordered sets and lattices have been studied in various researches. In particular, the covering dimension, the Krull dimension and the small inductive dimension have been studied extensively for the class of nite lattices. In this paper, we insert new meaning of dimension for nite lattices called large inductive dimension and denoted by Ind. We study various of its properties based on minimal covers. Also, given two nite lattices, we study the dimension Ind of their linear sum, Cartesian, lexicographic and rectangular product, investigating the behavior of this dimension. In addition, we study relations of this new dimension with the small inductive dimension, covering dimension and Krull dimension, presenting various facts and examples that strengthen the corresponding results.
item.dc:creator: D. Georgiou, Y. Hattori, A. Megaritis, F. Sereti

item.title: Schur ultrafilters and Bohr compactifications of topological groups
item.description: arXiv:2409.07280v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this paper we investigate Schur ultrafilters on groups. Using the algebraic structure of Stone-\v{C}ech compactifications of discrete groups and Schur ultrafilters, we give a new description of Bohr compactifications of topological groups. This approach allows us to characterize chart groups that are topological groups. Namely, a chart group $G$ is a topological group if and only if each Schur ultrafilter on $G$ converges to the unit of $G$.
item.dc:creator: Serhii Bardyla, Pavol Zlato\v{s}
